intro: Dalenia magnibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract dalenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy bracts that resemble small leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are borne in clusters at the base of the plant. Dalenia magnibracteata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various soil conditions.
